text: Yahweh’s Judgment and Help
Ah, destroyer, and yourself not destroyed!
And treacherous one, and no one has dealt treacherously with him!\f + \fr 33:1 \ft Many manuscripts suggest “you” rather than “him” \f*
When you ⸤cease⸥\f + \fr 33:1 \ft Literally “finishing” \f* destroying, you will be destroyed.
When you stop dealing treacherously, one will deal treacherously with you.
Yahweh, be gracious to us, we wait for you.
Be our\f + \fr 33:2 \ft Hebrew “their” \f* arm in the mornings,
indeed our salvation in \add the\add* time of trouble.
At \add the\add* sound of tumult, peoples fled;
because of your exaltation, nations scattered.
And your spoil is gathered,
\add as\add* the gathering of the locust,
as a swarm of locusts storming on it.
Yahweh \add is\add* exalted, for \add he\add* dwells \add on\add* high;
he filled Zion \add with\add* justice and righteousness,
and he will be the security of your times,
an abundance of salvation, wisdom, and knowledge.
The fear of Yahweh \add is\add* his treasure.
Look! Their heroes cry out \add in the\add* street;
\add the\add* messengers of peace weep bitterly.
Highways are deserted;
\add the\add* traveler \add on the\add* road ceases.
One breaks a treaty,
he rejects \add the\add* cities,\f + \fr 33:8 \ft A Dead Sea Scroll reads “witnesses” \f*
he does not hold man in high regard.
\add The\add* land mourns; it languishes.
Lebanon feels abashed; it withers.
Sharon is like the desert,
and Bashan and Carmel ⸤are losing their leaves⸥.\f + \fr 33:9 \ft Literally “shaking off” \f*
“Now I will arise,” says Yahweh.
“Now I will lift myself up proudly;
now I will raise myself.
You conceive dry grass, you bring forth stubble;
your breath \add is\add* a fire; it will consume you.
And \add the\add* peoples will be burning \add to\add* lime—
they are burned \add like\add* thorns \add that have been\add* cut down in the fire.
\add You who are\add* far away, hear what I have done;
and \add you who are\add* near, know my might!”
Sinners are afraid in Zion;
trembling has seized \add the\add* godless:
“Who of us can ⸤live⸥\f + \fr 33:14 \ft Literally “dwell as an alien” \f* \add with\add* devouring fire?
Who of us can ⸤live⸥\f + \fr 33:14 \ft Literally “dwell as an alien” \f* \add with\add* everlasting consuming hearths?”
He who walks \add in\add* righteousness
and speaks uprightness,
who rejects \add the\add* gain of extortion,
who ⸤refuses⸥\f + \fr 33:15 \ft Literally “shakes his hand from the taking of” \f* \add a\add* bribe,
who stops up his ears\f + \fr 33:15 \ft Hebrew “ear” \f* from hearing ⸤bloodshed⸥\f + \fr 33:15 \ft Literally “blood” \f*
and shuts his eyes from seeing evil.
That one will live \add on the\add* heights;
\add the\add* fortresses of rocks \add will be\add* his refuge.
His food \add will\add* be given;
his waters\f + \fr 33:16 \ft Hebrew “water” \f* \add will\add* endure.
Your eyes will see \add the\add* king in his beauty;
they will see a ⸤distant land⸥.\f + \fr 33:17 \ft Literally “land of distance” \f*
Your ⸤mind⸥\f + \fr 33:18 \ft Literally “heart” \f* will meditate \add on the\add* terror:
“Where \add is the\add* one who counted?
Where \add is the\add* one who weighed out?
Where \add is the\add* one who counted the towers?”
You will not see \add the\add* insolent people,
\add the\add* people ⸤whose language is too obscure to understand⸥,\f + \fr 33:19 \ft Literally “obscure of lip than to hear” \f*
\add whose\add* stammering of tongue ⸤cannot be understood⸥.\f + \fr 33:19 \ft Literally “there is no understanding” \f*
Look \add on\add* Zion, the city of our appointed festivals!
Your eyes will see Jerusalem,
an undisturbed settlement,
a tent ⸤that is not moved⸥.\f + \fr 33:20 \ft Literally “not he is loaded” \f*
No one will ever pull out its tent pegs,
and none of its ropes will be torn in two.
Rather, there Yahweh \add will be\add* mighty for us,
a place of rivers \add and\add* ⸤broad streams⸥,\f + \fr 33:21 \ft Literally “streams broad of hands” \f*
a galley ship with\f + \fr 33:21 \ft Or “of” \f* oars\f + \fr 33:21 \ft Hebrew “oar” \f* cannot go in it,
and a mighty ship cannot pass through it.
For Yahweh \add is\add* our judge; Yahweh \add is\add* our lawgiver.
Yahweh \add is\add* our king; he \add is the one who\add* will save us.
Your riggings hang slack;
they do not hold the base of their mast firm,
they do not spread out \add the\add* sail.
Then \add the\add* prey of spoil \add in\add* abundance will be divided;
\add the\add* lame will take plunder.
And no inhabitant will say, “I am sick”;
the people who live in it, \add their\add* iniquity \add will be\add* taken away.
